p: It is important to note, however, that passive surveillance data have potential limitations influenced by health seeking behaviors and other critical sociocultural drivers, and data may, therefore, not fully represent the population under study (for a full review see [ 25]). Additional community-level studies are important and can provide insight into potential infection dynamics not captured by passive surveillance systems [ 29]. Nevertheless, the seasonâ€”diarrhea interactions observed here underscore the important role environmental drivers may have for predicting the timing of disease outbreaks as well as the demographic and clinical characteristics of patients affected by season.
